Operation 'firebasehosting.projects.sites.customDomains.operations.delete' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, unclear_purpose, not_actionable, poor_ai_interpretability. The original description lacks a summary entirely and provides minimal context about what the operation does (or doesn't do). For AI agents, it's critical to understand that this is an unsupported operation to avoid attempting it. The improved version clarifies the unsupported status upfront, explains the consequence, and provides guidance on when (never) to use it.

data.current_description: DeleteOperation is a part of the google.longrunning.Operations interface, but is not implemented for CustomDomain resources.
data.summary_suggestion: Delete operation not supported for custom domains
data.description_suggestion: This operation is not implemented for CustomDomain resources. Attempting to delete a long-running operation associated with a custom domain will result in an error. Use this endpoint only to understand API capabilities; CustomDomain operation deletion is not supported in Firebase Hosting.
data.reasoning: The original description lacks a summary entirely and provides minimal context about what the operation does (or doesn't do). For AI agents, it's critical to understand that this is an unsupported operation to avoid attempting it. The improved version clarifies the unsupported status upfront, explains the consequence, and provides guidance on when (never) to use it.

message: Operation 'firebasehosting.operations.list' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Missing summary makes it unclear at a glance what this operation does. The description mentions filtering but doesn't explain what filters are available or what the response contains. Enhanced version specifies that results are paginated, clarifies the Operation resource type returned, and maintains the error handling information for completeness.

data.current_description: Lists operations that match the specified filter in the request. If the server doesn't support this method, it returns `UNIMPLEMENTED`.
data.description_suggestion: Lists long-running operations that match the specified filter criteria. Accepts filter parameters to narrow results by operation status, name, or other attributes. Returns a paginated list of Operation resources matching the filter. If the server doesn't support this method, it returns an UNIMPLEMENTED error.
data.reasoning: Missing summary makes it unclear at a glance what this operation does. The description mentions filtering but doesn't explain what filters are available or what the response contains. Enhanced version specifies that results are paginated, clarifies the Operation resource type returned, and maintains the error handling information for completeness.

message: Operation 'firebasehosting.projects.sites.customDomains.operations.cancel' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, unclear_purpose, not_actionable, poor_ai_interpretability. Like the delete operation, this lacks a summary and provides insufficient context about its unsupported status. AI agents need clear guidance that this operation cannot be used for CustomDomain resources. The improved version explicitly states the unsupported status, clarifies that requests will fail, and explains why the endpoint exists (interface compliance) to prevent agent confusion and retry attempts.

data.current_description: CancelOperation is a part of the google.longrunning.Operations interface, but is not implemented for CustomDomain resources.
data.summary_suggestion: Cancel operation not supported for custom domains
data.description_suggestion: This operation is not implemented for CustomDomain resources. Attempting to cancel a long-running operation associated with a custom domain will result in an error. The CancelOperationRequest body is accepted but will not perform any cancellation. This endpoint is provided for API interface compliance but should not be used for CustomDomain operations.
data.reasoning: Like the delete operation, this lacks a summary and provides insufficient context about its unsupported status. AI agents need clear guidance that this operation cannot be used for CustomDomain resources. The improved version explicitly states the unsupported status, clarifies that requests will fail, and explains why the endpoint exists (interface compliance) to prevent agent confusion and retry attempts.
